summary: Life Changing (Part 7 - After Credit Scene)
title: Life Changing (Part 7 - After Credit Scene)
body:
Note: Surprise! I’m not done with you yet xD

Warnings: Captain Marvel spoilers

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Reader

Words: 453

You can find the links to the previous parts on my masterlist (the link is in my bio) :)

.

It was easy to convince yourself that the world still was as it had always been when you sat outside the compound, in middle of the wide green field a few meters away from the facility. The birds still chirped as they always had… Out there you felt the closest to peaceful since that day when Thanos wiped out half of all living creatures.

You didn’t know how the others coped, but most of the time everyone was always inside, either looking at the numbers of the dead, as if staring long enough would somehow make them magically count back down or watching Fury’s pager beeping periodically, wondering who it was sending a signal to.

You knew, of course. Even if you hadn’t recognized the pager at first, the symbol on its tiny display was so well known to you that it sometimes even haunted your dreams. 

In your opinion waiting for her to answer the call was as useless as staring and the demographic maps… You had waited over twenty years for her to come back to no avail. Why should it be any different now?

You hoped so badly for yourself to be wrong about it though, you really didn’t want to give up hope… But sometimes… sometimes everything just seemed futile. And yet you still wished for her to come back whenever you spotted a shooting star in the sky as you lay out there on the field at night when you couldn’t sleep.

You rubbed your eyes when you spotted a beam of light in the sky. It was daytime… you squeezed your eyes shut, it wouldn’t surprise you if you were starting to hallucinate. Who wouldn’t grow a little crazy in today’s world?

And yet, when you opened your eyes again, it was still there, a glowing point in the sky growing bigger and bigger as it rushed toward the compound.

You scrambled to your feet. This couldn’t be… but even though you still weren’t convinced that what you saw was real you started running towards the compound, pushing yourself as fast as you could.

.

Judging by the burnt patch of grass right in front of the compound’s entrance she had been faster than you, of course she had been… You didn’t want to lose any more time, so you moved quickly as you hurried through the floors of the facility, knowing exactly to which room she’d follow the signal of the pager.

You stopped in the doorway to the room, blinking the tears away that had shot into your eyes.

“Where is Fury?” you heard her ask, her voice making your heart skip a beat.

You swallowed heavily and took a step into the room.

“Carol?”

.

Y/N L/N will return in Avengers: Endgame*

*(If I survive watching the movie that is…)

.

Tags:

Permanent: @pamplemousse-m @marvelouspottering @aspiring-bookcollector @angelklementieffs @nerdofthehighestcalibre @mummy-woves-you @platonic-plots @startrekkingaroundasgard @yanginginthere @bennyboibaby @hakuna–fuckin–matata @sincereleygmg

Carol Danvers: @wherethesinslie @th3nextsupreme @marvelb00kwolf

Life Changing: @spiderboy-needs-a-break @marvelrose @ddaeng-danvers @soullesstrashcan @morgannope @chonisbestmistake @prettylittlealiengirl @musicals-n-chill @cuddlememerrick

blog.name: lindsglenne
blog.description:
My name is Lindsay and I'm just trying to figure my shit out. Books. Comedy. Film. Spoonie. Fibromyalgia. Chronic Headaches/Migraines. Degenerative Disc Disease. GERD.

Instagram: @lindsglenne

summary: Well, this month I read so much that I have to separate my entertainment wrap-up. So let’s get in to all the great things I...
body:
Well, this month I read so much that I have to separate my entertainment wrap-up. So let’s get in to all the great things I watched with my eyeballs in the month of March.

TV!

Sex Education ♥♥♥♥♥
I wrote a whole post about this awesome show. Can it come back already?

Shrill ♥♥♥♥♥
I’m going to write an entire post about my new found love of everything Lindy West. I listened to the audiobook and watched the television show—I cried during both. I have so many feelings about this show—it really affected me to my core.

MOVIES!

Captain Marvel:  5/5
Five Feet Apart: 4/5
Modern Life is Rubbish: 3/5
In a Relationship: 3.5/5

Ben is Back: 3.5/5
Stan & Ollie: 3.5/5
Social Animals: 3/5
Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse: 5/5
Vox Lux: 2/5

As you can see, I was all about the superheroes this month. Captain Marvel was so much fun! It felt like a buddy cop movie between Carol Danvers and Nick Fury with a kitty sidekick named Goose. I love that they became such good friends from doing this movie. My sister had warned me not to see Spider-Man in theaters because of the crazy animation and my bad headaches—and I’m glad I took her advice. The animation was SO cool and dynamic. The whole movie was really great and funny, but had a lot of heart. I think it was a wonderful way to bring in new fans to the Spider-Verse.

LIVE!

I was so lucky to be able to go see Elton John on his Goodbye Yellow Brick Road finale tour. Seeing Elton was such an experience, something you never know would actually happen—a total bucket list moment. You don’t realize how many songs you actually know until you see someone as big Elton. The only downside was that he didn’t play any Lion King songs. 

Movie/TV Monthly Recap Well, this month I read so much that I have to separate my entertainment wrap-up. So let’s get in to all the great things I watched with my eyeballs in the month of March.

tags: why the hell WOULDN'T people want to see more of the female characters?
summary: The best part about all those ‘men’ complaining about Brie Larson being forward with her feminist attitude is the fact that they...
body:
The best part about all those ‘men’ complaining about Brie Larson being forward with her feminist attitude is the fact that they bitch, whine, and complain about how she was being racist and sexist towards white men. They complain about how she was getting political.

It’s awesome because it shows that they themselves are sexist. They themselves are racist. They want to play the victim so bad that they make the claim that Brie was being sexist and racist towards white men.

It also show that they do have an issue with women in politics. Specifically, women that don’t share their views. They want to oppress people’s rights, while playing the victim to justify their oppression.

And it’s fun seeing the whinny pissbabies trying to justify their hatred of the Captain Marvel movie. They hate-watch it. They wanted to find something to be angry at because they’re all afraid.

They’re afraid that if women get more rights, then it means that they won’t be able to oppress them anymore. Because white men are acting exactly like this:

And yes. We know “Not all men!”

Just note that if you feel the need to say that, then you feel as if this post applies to you. Which means that on some level, you feel as if women shouldn’t have more rights.

Basically, if you feel called out by this post, then that means it applies to you.

blog.name: serenity-and-stardust
blog.title: Just Breathe
blog.description:
"I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in my life. And I am horribly limited."
- Sylvia Plath // 40. Female. //
21+ // NSFW. // Autobiographical. // Reader. Writer. Thinker. // Music and movie lover. // Favorites. // Sex? Yes, please. // Reality, dreams, desires, and memories. // Pro-choice and a believer of the 2nd amendment. Do not presume you know me. I'm multi-faceted. // I speak my truths and my experiences. // A good friend once said: "Fight the good fight. Finish the race. Keep the faith." // I'm trying not to let him down.

summary:

Me: Exactly. Never forget that.
